Subject: Music
Text: By the end of the Foundation year, students describe experiences, observations, ideas and/or feelings about arts works they encounter at school, home and/or in the community.

Subject: Music
Text: Students use play, imagination, arts knowledge, processes and/or skills to create and share arts works in different forms.

Subject: Music
Text: By the end of Year 2, students identify where they experience music.

Subject: Music
Text: They describe where, why and/or how people across cultures, communities and/or other contexts experience music.

Subject: Music
Text: Students demonstrate listening skills.

Subject: Music
Text: They use the elements of music to improvise and/or compose music.

Subject: Music
Text: They sing and play music in informal settings.

Subject: Music
Text: By the end of Year 4, students describe the use of elements of music in music they compose, perform and/or experience.

Subject: Music
Text: They describe where, why and/or how music is composed and/or performed across cultures, times, places and/or other contexts.

Subject: Music
Text: Students demonstrate listening skills when performing and composing.

Subject: Music
Text: They combine the elements of music to compose music that communicates ideas.

Subject: Music
Text: They sing and play music they have learnt and/or composed in informal settings.

Subject: Music
Text: By the end of Year 6, students explain how elements of music are manipulated in music they compose, perform and/or experience.

Subject: Music
Text: They describe how music composed and/or performed across contexts, cultures, times and/or places communicates ideas, perspectives and/or meaning.

Subject: Music
Text: They describe how music is used to continue and revitalise cultures.

Subject: Music
Text: Students demonstrate listening and aural skills when composing and performing.

Subject: Music
Text: They use elements of music and compositional devices to compose music that communicates ideas, and when practising music for a performance.

Subject: Music
Text: They notate, document and/or record the music they compose.

Subject: Music
Text: They perform music in formal and/or informal settings.

Subject: Music
Text: By the end of Year 6, students explain the use of elements, concepts and/or conventions in arts works they create and/or experience.

Subject: Music
Text: They describe how the arts communicate ideas, perspectives and/or meaning across cultures, times, places and/or other contexts.

Subject: Music
Text: They describe how the arts are used to continue and revitalise cultures.

Subject: Music
Text: Students use subject-specific knowledge, elements, concepts, conventions, materials, skills and/or processes to create arts works that communicate ideas, perspectives and/or meaning.

Subject: Music
Text: They demonstrate safe practices.

Subject: Music
Text: They present and perform their arts works in formal and/or informal settings.
